Lady Kaede, in mourning, rosary in hand, comes up the sta Kurogane bows.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: Kurogane. There is salt at the Second Castle, is there not?

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Yes, there is. Why?

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: I mean if you bring her head back without preserving it in salt, in this heat, we shall have to refrain from looking at it. Kurogane is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is too merciless a thing to do to such a beautiful lady. Since you are going personally, Kurogane, I know there will be no error. I leave the matter to you. Do as you see fit.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Yes, my lady. Jiro quietly watches Lady Kaede.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hidetora is asleep. Kyoami, beside him, examines the old manвЂ™s haggard face.  146 73.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Why am I still serving such a crazy old man? If the rock upon which you are seated starts to roll down a slope, you must jump off. Otherwise you will be crushed together with the rock. Only fools remain on a falling rock. He stands and starts for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Where am I? Kyoami looks back at him and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: This is Heaven. (Returns to Hidetora, helps him lie down again) Be a good boy. Go to sleep. (Sits beside him) Amazing! I think it has been my work since I was a child to rock him to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The Ichimonji standard; TaroвЂ™s armor and his helmet wit orb plume and colored braids displayed on the alcove. Jir and Lady Kaede are making love, in the daytime, in front the display. All the more appealing is that she is in mourning clothes. A voice is heard from below the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: General Kurogane is here! Jiro and Lady Kaede are alarmed. They quickly straighten their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Let him in. Kurogane comes up the stairs, holding in his hand a packa wrapped in white figured silk. He lays it by his knees an prostrates himself before Jiro and Lady Kaede.  74.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: I have returned, my lord. Jiro cannot take his eyes away from the package wrapped i silk by KuroganeвЂ™s knees, and is silent. Lady Kaede, me glancing at it, answers for Jiro.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: Thank you for you trouble.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Not at all, my lady. Now then, the article I have brought according to your precise instructions... please have a good look. He takes the package and presents it to Kaede. Jiro, trembling, looks at it, then turns his eyes to Kurogane w a look of censure. Kurogane, with a look of feigned innocence, is watching Lady Kaede.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: (Looking at Jiro from the corner of her eyes) Well, then, I shall first examine it. She pulls the package of white silk to her with a casual that contrasts with JiroвЂ™s trembling face. Jiro turns h eyes away. Kaede unwraps the many layers of the package. As it is unwrapped, salt falls out, then finally a large lump of s appears. KaedeвЂ™s long, beautiful fingers brush away the All of a sudden she turns white.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is this? Kurogane, your joking has gone too far!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: You do not like it? Did I overlook something?

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: How dare you? She thrusts the package aside. The lump of salt breaks op and falls away, and a stone foxвЂ™s head rolls out. Jiro at it in mute amazement, then quickly looks at Kurogane.  75.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: What is this? Lady SuГ©, whom I killed, must have been a fox in disguise. I have been tricked!

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: You have joked enough! This is from a fox statue from an Inari shrine!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Well, this is a crafty fox... After disguising itself as a human, it then turned to stone!

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: Kurogane! Do you intend to make a fool of me?

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Not at all! There are a lot of foxes around here, and it is said that they often trick men. (To Jiro) You, too, my lord, must be careful. Foxes often take the form of a woman in order to work their evil deeds... Far away, in Central Asia, a fox, which disguised itself as the wife of King Pan Tsu, made the king kill a thousand men, and later in China, during the Chou dynasty, there was one who became the queen consort of King Yu and destroyed his country. Here in Japan, the fox served at court as Princess Tamamo and worked even more treachery. It is said that she finally turned into a white fox with nine tails. After that there was no trace of the white fox. It is possible it might have settled down around here. Be careful, my lord, be careful. Excuse me! Kurogane rattles off his entire swift speech in one breat without stopping, then bows and exits. Kaede and Jiro are left defeated.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: (Glares at Jiro) Lord Jiro! Is this how you respond to my request? How can you conspire with Kurogane to fool me like this?  76.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: No, Kaede! You are wrong!

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: I have had enough! She rises and crosses to the stairs, followed by Jiro.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Wait! Kaede. This is KuroganeвЂ™s...

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: It is always Kurogane! Is he your only retainer? He has already acted the villain, killing Lord Taro. Now he has played hero, saving Lady SuГ©. He is a monster. And you call him your right arm. What a pity! Jiro is silent.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I shall not see you again until I see Lady SuГ©вЂ™s head! She descends the stairs. Jiro is immobile at the top of t stairs, straight as a stick.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Lady SuГ©, Tsurumaru, and the old woman are hurrying. The woman is in the lead guiding the others, carrying bundles SuГ© is holding TsurumaruвЂ™s hand. The blind boy has a c

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: (Suddenly stops) Sister! My flute!

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Forget it. We have no time to spare for a flute. We must hurry.

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: But I have treasured it since I was a child.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: What shall we do?  77.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: You must hurry because, as Kurogane said, we will have someone after us very soon. I will return and get the flute. Will you wait at the remains of the castle?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: But you are old. I will go back for it.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: No, my lady. You wanted to see the remains of your familyвЂ™s castle, so we are taking this detour. Hurry there with Master Tsurumaru, and pray for your ruined family. Once in another domain, you will never be able to visit it again. SuГ© is silent, filled with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, then... She hands the bundles to SuГ© and trudges back along the trail. SuГ© and Tsurumaru are left alone. The sound of th wind whining through the trees. SuГ© shudders as if frightened.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Tsurumaru, let us hurry. They hasten on their way, hand in hand, up the hill. SUE (CONTвЂ™D) Tsurumaru! I can see our castle! I mean the remains of the castle!

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: Which way, sister?

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Over there... She suddenly realizes she should not have said this and g at her blind brother in remorse and sorrow, speechless. T remains of Azusa Castle are in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hidetora and Kyoami are ambling along. Hidetora is wander this way and that, Kyoami following as if he were a nurse taking care of a child. When Hidetora nears the stone wal Kyoami pulls him back to safety. When Hidetora crouches, Kyoami stops and patiently waits on him. His attitude is kind, but his words are rough, as if he were master and Hidetora his servant. The passage they are treading is bleak and devastated. Th two look as if they were the only survivors of the worldв final carnage. And their conversation, too, sounds as if were in some other world, muttering about human beings an their stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Heaven and earth have turned upside down. I was mad and made him laugh before. But now he is mad and makes me laugh. Come, do not be silent. Say something. You speak of nonsense; I speak of truth. Let us see if our conversation can continue smoothly. Now! (Shouts ) Old man! Hidetora, who has been gazing absently at a point in spac reacts and regards Kyoami.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: A snakeвЂ™s egg is white and beautiful. A birdвЂ™s egg is spotted and dirty.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: This is a castle. There is a stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: The little bird deserted the dirty egg and sat on the white one.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Looks up at the wall) Strange.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: A snake emerged from the hatched egg.  153 79.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: There is nothing on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: The bird raised the snake, only to fall prey to it.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Where am I? Who am I?

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: The bird was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Saburo! Saburo! Kyoami looks hopefully at Hidetora. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) Oh, it hurts. I am going mad!

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: If a madman goes mad again, will he become sane?

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: I am a worm! Do not crush me!

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: You will not be crushed. Miserable worms are not even worth being crushed.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Who are you? Kyoami, in despair, pushes Hidetora away, crouches, and starts crying. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) Is someone crying?... Who is crying? Kyoami suddenly springs up and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: All human beings cry when they are born. They die after they have cried enough. Horrified, Hidetora runs away. Kyoami, too, runs after hi

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Saburo and Tango, both in armor, ride across the river leading a troop. JiroвЂ™s garrison, guarding the boundary hurriedly retreats.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: A messenger rushes in and kneels in front of Jiro, Kuroga Naganuma, and Shirane.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Lord Saburo and his men crossed the boundary river and have taken a position on Hachiman Field.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: I fail to understand. Lord Saburo brought only his own men. What can they possibly do? Another messenger comes running.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: A message from Lord Saburo!

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: What? What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: вЂњSaburo has come to receive his father...вЂќ Jiro looks puzzled. MESSENGER (CONTвЂ™D) вЂњ,..Unless he is interfered with, he will withdraw, taking his father with him in peace.вЂќ That is his message. Surprised, not expecting this message, they look at each other. Yet another messenger rushes in and kneels in front of Ji and his confidants. MESSENGER (CONTвЂ™D) FujimakiвЂ™s army has advanced to the boundary!  157 158 81.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s well-trained and disciplined soldiers are wait calmly. Their banners and bannerets are azure, waving in summer breeze. Saburo, Tango, and Hatakeyama are looking up at the mount ridge behind them. The ridge is lined with waves of FujimakiвЂ™s soldiers and their white banners.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: That embarrasses me. I told him repeatedly that I do not need his support.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: You do not have to be embarrassed. Thanks to Lord FujimakiвЂ™s demonstration of his possible invasion, the enemy on this Hachiman Field cannot make an aggressive move. It also enables us to rescue the Great Lord from Azusa Field.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: But this aggressive deployment of his army is not a peaceful way. One wrong move might provoke a war. That embarrasses me.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Fujimaki, with his army behind him, turns to an old gener beside him.

dialogues.speaker: FUJIMAKI
dialogues.text: Am I too hasty? The general returns a questioning look.

dialogues.speaker: FUJIMAKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was so worried that I brought my army, but I am afraid my son-in-law will be angry with me.  159 160 82.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: As long as you stay here within the boundary, he has no reason to be angry with you.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Messengers are galloping this way and that.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Prepare for war! Suddenly the castle is thrown into a turmoil.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Jiro, Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: My lord. You should not fight now. Send a messenger that you will let Lord Saburo have the Great Lord, and avoid this war!

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: How can I let him have my father? If I did, Saburo, in alliance with him, would soon raise his banners against me, using the excuse that he would punish my men for treason.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: But even if we wanted to give up the Great Lord, we do not know where he is. Jiro is silent. KUROGANE (CONTвЂ™D) At present, the people of our land are in confusion and distress because of this series of changes in rulership. And Fujimaki and Ayabe are seeking a chance to invade by making use of the confusion. Now is the time for defense, not offense.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Reporting! A message from the Lady Kaede to the Lord Jiro!  161 162-163 164 83. Jiro looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She says she is expecting the immediate return of the Lord Jiro for the ceremony of congratulations for going to war. Jiro steals an embarrassed glance at Kurogane.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s position with azure banners and bannerets. Bey are a few mounted scouts with red bannerets that indicate they belong to Jiro. They gallop up and down as they obse SaburoвЂ™s position.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: All right. The enemy main force will come soon. When they come, we will go through the forest and rescue the Great Lord.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Do not be hasty.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Kaede puts the sakГ© server on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: How stupid! Jiro, at the ceremony of congratulations, is about to dri he stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Giving the Great Lord to Lord Saburo means giving him your own head, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: I said so, too.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: Then why did you alter your opinion? Did Kurogane change your mind again?  165 166

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: But... it is not a good time for us to fight.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: Good leadership decides who wins. Now you lead. Why be afraid of Fujimaki and Ayabe? This is your chance to beat them and make their domains yours. As leader of the House of Ichimonji, you should have that ambition. Jiro is overwhelmed by her eloquence.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the first place, it was a grievous mistake to have spared the Great Lord even though he had gone mad. Mercy is not necessary for a Samurai.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: But how can I kill my father when I do not know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: (Laughs ) Lord Saburo knows where he is. He would not want to take a missing man home if he had not known. Jiro reacts.

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell Lord Saburo that he can have his father. Watch carefully how he moves, and if he goes anywhere, tail him. You will find where you father is. Then send assassins to him, and that will end it. 84. She picks up the sakГ© server and pours Jiro a drink. Jir holds the cup, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hidetora and Kyoami come walking along.  167 85.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Stops, looks around) I am lost.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Human beings are always lost. Human beings have walked the same way again and again from the earliest times. If you prefer not to do it, jump from this wall. Hidetora suddenly jumps. Taken aback, Kyoami looks down f the top of the stone wall, then runs down the meandering passage as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hidetora looks around, bewildered, while seated on a thic growth of vines. Kyoami comes running.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Great Lord! (Clings to Hidetora)

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Seemingly transfixed) Who is that? Kyoami finds traces of sanity in his face, reacts, and lo back. Lady SuГ© is standing on the stone wall of what was the donjon of her fatherвЂ™s castle. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) SuГ©! (Runs toward the foot of the wall) SuГ©! Shocked, Lady SuГ© is immobile on the wall at the sight o ruined lord. Hidetora looks up at her then glances around fearfully. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) These are the remains of SuГ©вЂ™s dead fatherвЂ™s castle, which I destroyed. Why am I here? Tsurumaru appears on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tsurumaru!  168 169

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: (Listens) That voice is... HidetoraвЂ™s! As he hears the voice, Tsurumaru swings up his cane. His hair almost bristling with rage, his young and handsome f seems to intensify his wrath and the tragedy he has suffe Hidetora stares at the blind boy, then staggers back, shouting, trying to flee.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Forgive me! Forgive me!

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: (Surprised; stops Hidetora) Great Lord! Do not leave! With the extraordinary strength of a desperate man, Hidet pushes him aside and runs away. Kyoami pursues.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Kyoami misses Hidetora in the labyrinth of passages and r to the underground storeroom.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Kyoami rushes in. Hidetora is not in sight. He runs out.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Kyoami comes running and looks around. Hidetora is seen running in Azusa Field as Kyoami looks down. Kyoami hurri runs after the old lord.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: JiroвЂ™s army is taking a position against SaburoвЂ™s tro cavalry churns up clouds of dust, foot soldiers hastening their posts making more dust. Through the haze, we can se various banners and bannerets on horses and soldiersвЂ™ b in flamboyant colors, as well as the shining tips of spea moving quickly this way and that. Out of the crowd and dust emerges a messenger on horsebac moving toward SaburoвЂ™s position. He dismounts in front Saburo and kneels, a hand on the ground.  87.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Lord JiroвЂ™s answer is this: вЂњWe have no intention of stopping you. Receive the Great Lord and quickly withdraw from our domain.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: All right. The messenger bows, mounts, and gallops away.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Lord Saburo. Let us go at once to the Great Lord.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Not so fast. If we move rashly, they will find out where my father is. It would be dangerous. We had best wait until night. Hatakeyama looks away and raises his spear to point to th ridge.

dialogues.speaker: HATAKEYAMA
dialogues.text: My lord, the Ayabe army is moving in his domain.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: (Looks at ridge) Having smelled blood, the vulture is seeking the prey!

dialogues.speaker: 169C EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Ayabe is looking down at the field, his army behind him.

dialogues.speaker: 169D EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Jiro, Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma are looking up at t Ayabe army on the ridge. JiroвЂ™s horse is restless, resp to its masterвЂ™s feelings.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: (Regards Jiro) My lord, be calm. Now is the time to decide the ruler of this land. You must show your immovable strength and give neither Fujimaki nor Ayabe any opportunity for invasion.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: (Looks over at SaburoвЂ™s position) He said he came to receive Father, but he is still quiet. What is he planning? EXTERIOR - SABUROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY Saburo is gazing at the sun in the western sky.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Lady SuГ© and Tsurumaru.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: (Gazing at field) She is late. Even though she is old and cannot walk fast, she is late. I will go back and see what happened.

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: No! (Gropes for her, taker her hand) Do not go! I do not want the flute anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: Are you unable to understand? As if you were a little child...

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: Sister, I do not want to be alone again.

dialogues.speaker: SUE
dialogues.text: I will not be long. I will return soon.

dialogues.speaker: TSURUMARU
dialogues.text: Sister!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: JiroвЂ™s position and SaburoвЂ™s facing each other quietl Except for the waving of banners and bannerets, there is movement on either side.
EXTERIOR - SABUROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY A messenger comes galloping up, Kyoami behind him on his horse. He stops in front of Saburo and Tango.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: I found this man in Azusa Field. He was calling the Great Lord, so I brought him here.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Kyoami! Where is the Great Lord?

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: (Almost falls from the horse) Forgive me! He has gone! I do not know where he is. Tango sighs, regards Saburo.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Kyoami! You lost him in Azusa Field?

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: We have no choice. We cannot wait until night now. (Calling) Hatakeyama!

dialogues.speaker: HATAKEYAMA
dialogues.text: (Voice-over) My lord. Hatakeyama, the garrison leader, comes galloping up.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Tango and I will go to Azusa field with ten men. Take command here. Draw the enemy to your position and never let it go. EXTERIOR - JIROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY Jiro notices the sudden move in SaburoвЂ™s position. A sm party is moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have started to move. That party led by Saburo is heading for Azusa Field... Commander of the gunners! Take your men to Azusa Field and lay an ambush, the one who kills Saburo will be given the highest honors! Surprised, Kurogane rides to Jiro.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: What are you saying! If you break your promise to Lord Saburo, war is inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Then so be it! Kurogane is bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sooner or later war becomes inevitable. If later, Saburo will have enough reason to attack us. Better to fight today, blaming him for invasion, than to wait for his abuse.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Idiot! Saburo is not our only enemy !

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: I know. If Fujimaki and Ayabe attempt to cross the border, they will be welcome. We will counterattack and break into their realm. It will be or chance to take their domains.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: What brave words! But battles are not won with words.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Why do you fear this war? You always rebuked me for my defensive thoughts. Where is that Kurogane? As Kaede said, you are a coward in the guise of a villain!  171Вўc

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: (Glares at Jiro) You have again been influenced by Lady Kaede.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Silence! If you are loath to fight, do not follow me! If you fear this war, desert!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: (Painfully watches Jiro) My lord... where do you think I could go if I deserted you? Shirane and Naganuma, behind Kurogane, watch Jiro in disg Guiltily surveying their faces, Jiro has no further words them. As if to forget his remorse, he turns to the comman of gunners.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: (Shouting) Commander! What are you waiting for? Go!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: As you command. (To his men) Follow me! The commander hurriedly leads his gunners away, leaving a trail of dust. EXTERIOR - SABUROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY Hatakeyama watches the opposite position, where a sudden activity has arisen.

dialogues.speaker: HATAKEYAMA
dialogues.text: Messenger! Report to Lord Saburo! вЂњEnemy gunners have departed for Azusa Field. Be careful!вЂќ Tell him so. EXTERIOR - JIROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY Jiro raises his military fan.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Forward! Straight forward!

dialogues.speaker: 171F
dialogues.text: 172 92. Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma are disagreeably watching Jiro. Jiro's army begins to advance. EXTERIOR - SABUROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY

dialogues.speaker: HATAKEYAMA
dialogues.text: Damn them! They are breaking the agreement and trying to pick us off with their guns. We will move to the forest over there. Follow me! SaburoвЂ™s troops turn right in perfect formation and mov the forest that separates Azusa Field from Hachiman Field EXTERIOR - JIROвЂ™S POSITION - DAY Jiro, on horseback, sees this movement of SaburoвЂ™s troo

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Forward! Forward! Pursue the enemy! Turn left, with the left wing as an axis!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: My lord. If the battle begins, they will pull back into that forest. Our numerical superiority means nothing if we fight in the forest. It is easy to defend and difficult to attack.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: If they run into the forest, we will burn it!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Fujimaki and the old general are watching the Ichimonji realm.

dialogues.speaker: FUJIMAKI
dialogues.text: My son-in-lawвЂ™s troops are being pursued. I can no longer merely wait and watch.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GENERAL
dialogues.text: Our realm extends to the river. Your son-in-law would not blame you if you advanced to the border line.  173 174 175 176 177 93. The old general raises his whip, signaling his men who ar waiting behind, then gallops down the hill with Fujimaki. Fujimaki army follows, avalanching down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s troop is moving to the forest, JiroвЂ™s army f leftward. In the rear are Jiro and his staff members - Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma. Kurogane and the others as they look away.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: My lord! My lord! He points with his whip.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The Fujimaki army is avalanching down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Jiro reins in his horse. The horse rears up.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: (Glares) What is Ayabe doing? (Looks up at ridge in Ayabe realm) The Ayabe troop on the ridge is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. We will sweep SaburoвЂ™s troop away before Ayabe makes a move. Naganuma! You take command of the right wing and guard the river. Do not allow the enemy to cross, not even a single soldier! Go ahead! Naganuma gallops away.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: This vast field is quiet. The sun is setting on the ridge the mountain. The reddish sunlight has already begun to d the summer grass. Heaven is preparing a magnificent sunse

Saburo and Tango have stopped their horses in the summer grass. They are watching their men gallop this way and th They cast, from time to time, a worried glance at Kyoami, is crying and desperately searching for Hidetora.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s soldiers, led by Hatakeyama in front of the fo are bravely fighting the surrounding JiroвЂ™s army. The t though numerically inferior to the enemy force, looks invincible with the superb commander. Looking at the battle, Jiro is irate, his eyes reddened.

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: (Shouts ) What are you doing? They are few in number. Beat them! Crush them! A messenger comes galloping up.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: My lord! My lord! The main force of Ayabe has crossed the boundary and is swarming to the First Castle!

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: What! He gazes at the messenger, startled, then turns the gaze the ridge, where the Ayabe army is still quiet.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: They got us! It was a trick! The troop on the ridge is a decoy! Jiro, shocked, turns pale.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Master Saburo! Master Saburo! Saburo reacts and looks away. Kyoami is hopping and shout

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Here is the Great Lord! He is here! Saburo and Tango gallop up to him. He is holding Hidetora who has been lying in the grass. Saburo and Tango dismoun and help Kyoami. Hidetora looks at the three with vacant eyes.  95.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: How cruel you are! How could you pull me from my grave?

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t you recognize me?

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Regards SaburoвЂ™s helmet) You are a demon. You have horns on your head.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: He has yet to regain his senses. Let us carry him quietly. Hidetora looks around as if awakening from a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Looks up at sky) Oh, what a beautiful sky!... Am I in Heaven? Saburo exchanges glances with Tango.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Father? Who do you mean by вЂњFatherвЂќ? Wait. I remember. I had three sons. And you seem to be one of them.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Yes. I am Saburo.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Saburo?

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: It is true! You are Saburo! How can I show my face to you? With what words should I apologize? If you tell me to take poison, I will gladly comply.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: What are you saying? I do not hate you, Father.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Never try to deceive me. I have had my fill of sweet, false words! Saburo gazes at his old father, tears running down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Great Lord, look at his eyes. Does he look like a liar? Some speak of love without the least thought of it, but none sheds tears of sincerity like his without a full heart.

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Father, let us go. You can forget your bad dream by living with me.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Bursts into tears, stammers ) I wish you to forget my cruel attitude toward you. I hope you can forgive me. I was a stupid old fool!

dialogues.speaker: SABURO
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Saburo! Tango and Kyoami watch the father and son in each otherвЂ arms with silent relief and emotion.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The Ayabe army finally begisn to move, starting its invas As the soldiers look down...

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Jiro's army is retreating. Soldiers, on horseback and foo are desperately running for their lives in total confusio pale and stricken with fear. The red bannerets on their b whirl and dash like the gushing stream of a torrent. Crazily shouting amid the confusion are Jiro, Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma, their faces unusually ugly and fie But their voices are inaudible, drowned in the tumult.  97. SaburoвЂ™s troops, led by Hatakeyama, are in hot pursuit retreating enemy, triumphant but quiet, in ranks and formation, well trained and disciplined, in contrast to Jiro's army. Hatakeyama in the lead raises his spear and reins up his horse.

dialogues.speaker: HATAKEYAMA
dialogues.text: (Shouts ) Halt! That is enough!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s party, in single file, is crossing the field t the Fujimaki realm. Saburo is in the lead, Hidetora seate behind him on the same horse, Tango following, carrying Kyoami on his horse. They are quietly advancing in the so light of the setting sun - a picturesque sight. Suddenly the serenity is broken by gunshots. Several moun Samurai fall from their horses. Hidetora, holding Saburo behind, realizes that his son suddenly goes limp, his hea drooping.

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: (Surprised) Saburo! What is wrong, Saburo? Saburo is silent. His body slowly tilts, then finally fal from his horse together with Hidetora, who is clinging to him. Tango and Kyoami, shocked, dismount and run to them. Hidetora, bending over Saburo, suddenly looks up at Tango Kyoami, seeking rescue; he shouts in grief. His voice is sad it seems his heart is breaking. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) My son is dead!... I can still tell the living from the dead. Saburo is dead! I am alive; you are alive; but Saburo is not! Saburo! You must not die so soon! I have something to tell you. I owe you an apology! Can this be fair? Saburo! Come back to life!

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Great Lord! Compose yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not approach me! Saburo is dead! Every one of you is a murderer! Every one deserves death!

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Great Lord! Great Lord!

dialogues.speaker: HIDETORA
dialogues.text: Who are you? It is getting dark. Damn old fool! I can no longer live! I am suffocating! Someone, open my chest! Kyoami quickly loosens his clothes at the chest. HIDETORA (CONTвЂ™D) (Screams ) Saburo! (Goes limp) 98. It is the last of the great warrior who once reigned supr Kyoami clings to him.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: Great Lord! Great Lord! Tango watches everything in deep sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Kyoami. You must not call back his soul. You must not let him wander in this hellish world any longer. Tango and Kyoami, as well as SaburoвЂ™s men who are the corpse, silently behold the horrible sight of old warlord lying atop his lifeless son. surrounding death, the Over track, we hear hoofbeats. A messenger comes riding u

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: We have won! The enemy is retreating toward the First Castle!

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: (More sorrowful than pleased) What is this? Of all things, Master Saburo is no longer with us to hear! The Great Lord is no longer here to see it! Why? Why? Kyoami suddenly rises and spits toward Heaven.  184 185 99.

dialogues.speaker: KYOAMI
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Is there no God or Buddha in this world? Damnation! God and the Buddha are nothing but mischievous urchins! Are they so bored in Heaven that they enjoy watching men die like worms? Damn God! Is it so amusing to see and hear human beings cry and scream?

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: Enough! Do not slander God or the Buddha! They are the ones who are crying! The evil of human beings... the stupidity of the sinful creatures, who believe their survival depends on killing others, repeated again and again throughout all time... Even God or the Buddha cannot save us from it. Kyoami bursts out crying loudly.

dialogues.speaker: TANGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do not cry! This is nothing unusual in this mortal world. Human beings seek sorrow, not happiness, and prefer suffering to peace. Look at the First Castle! Those stupid people are fighting for sorrow and suffering, reveling in murder and bloodshed!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Shouts, screams, destruction, and massacre. Sounds of car and turmoil fill the castle - clanking swords and spears, storming footsteps, neighing horses, whistling arrows, reports of guns. Soldiers charging; clouds of dust. Banners and spearheads appearing and disappearing in the haze. Soldiers, friend foe, swarming toward the front gate, which is about to be closed. They fight to enter the castle before the gate is closed and squeeze themselves through the gap between the doors. Banners and bannerets of Ichimonji and Ayabe intermingle with each other.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The front gate is closed. Two groups of soldiers from bot sides are trapped in the square between the gates. They desperately struggle and fight for their lives, the slaug going unobserved. From the tower and the firing battlements above the squar bullets shower on the soldiers, killing them at random, friend and foe alike. Gunfire flashing in the slanting sunbeams in the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Jiro, Kurogane, Shirane, and Naganuma are silently watchi the confusion, uncomprehendingly. Samurai and soldiers ar running in all directions, not knowing what to do. Jiro a the other generals have no way of quelling the confusion. From the crazed mob a spirited Samurai, carrying somethin wrapped under his arm, runs toward Jiro.

dialogues.speaker: SAMURAI
dialogues.text: My lord! My lord!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: (To Samurai) Is it the Lord SaburoвЂ™s head? Or the Great LordвЂ™s? Either way it is of no use now.

dialogues.speaker: SAMURAI
dialogues.text: No. My lord ordered me to bring Lady SuГ©вЂ™s head. Astonished, Kurogane wrests the wrapping from the Samurai opens it. The cloth contains a beautiful floral design. EXTERIOR - TSURUMARUвЂ™S HUT - SUNSET Two corpses are resting on the grass and flowers of the f - the old woman and Lady SuГ©. The young ladyвЂ™s neck is covered with a bundle of wild flowers which were picked b rough hands, but her slender white arm is revealed from u her torn sleeve. The hand clasps TsurumaruвЂ™s flute - a and cruel sight.  190

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Kurogane looks up away from the wrapping, glares fiercely Jiro.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Is the master of this castle you or Lady Kaede? I serve you, my lord, but not Lady Kaede! (Runs to donjon)

dialogues.speaker: JIRO
dialogues.text: Wait! (Pursues)

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Fire arrows flying. INTERIOR - FIRST CASTLE - DONJON - LADY KAEDEвЂ™S ROOM - Despite the confusion and clamor, Lady Kaede is quietly seated, ignoring the women who run about seeking refuge. lips display a cold smile, as if she were enjoying the turmoil. The door bangs open, and Kurogane rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: Vixen! You fooled the lord! You caused him to do useless things, and you have now destroyed the House of Ichimonji! Now you should know the shallowness and stupidity of a womanвЂ™s wisdom!

dialogues.speaker: KAEDE
dialogues.text: (Calmly) It is not shallow or stupid. I wanted to see this castle burn and the House of Ichimonji ruined by the long grudge of my family. I wanted to see all this!

dialogues.speaker: KUROGANE
dialogues.text: To Hell with you! He draws his sword and kills her with a single stroke. A stream of smoke comes hovering over the blood-drenched co of Lady Kaede. The smoke creeps to Jiro, too, who is stan aghast, watching the body of his treacherous woman.  192 193 102. KUROGANE (CONTвЂ™D) (To Jiro) There is no escape. Prepare to die. I will follow you later.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The castle is belching fire and smoke. The Ayabe soldiers cheering and dancing crazily as they look up at the castl flames.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SaburoвЂ™s party, reduced in number, is crossing the fiel the glow of the evening. Two groups of soldiers are carry the corpses of Saburo and Hidetora on crossed spears. Tan and Kyoami as well as SaburoвЂ™s guards are silently foll SaburoвЂ™s troops, led by Hatakeyama, and the Fujimaki ca are sweeping the summer field like a black tide. They see corpses of Saburo and Hidetora, and lower their spears in mourning.

dialogues.speaker: FUJIMAKI
dialogues.text: Alas! Of all things! (Discouraged, his head drops, then he looks up) Men! Let us avenge my son-in-law! Follow me! We will take the First Castle!

dialogues.speaker: TANGO
dialogues.text: (Stops him) That is not necessary. Master Saburo had no ambition. He wanted to avoid war. You had better withdraw your army today out of mourning for Master Saburo, and pray for him. Fujimaki nods, raises his whip, and bisects the surroundi cavalry to make way for SaburoвЂ™s troops. Those with the bodies of Saburo and Hidetora resume their advance. Twilight creeps to the field, darkening the figures of th humans who have seen hell in this world. The glow of the evening is as red as blood, slowly paling, giving way to dusk. Azusa Field is beginning to disappear under the clo of evening. Far beyond the field, upon the stone walls of the remains Azusa Castle, a small figure is seen.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Tsurumaru wanders alone, cane in hand. His cane knocks at stones at the top of the wall, then finds nothing further Surprised, he steps back. The scroll falls from his hand, rolls down the high wall of the donjon, opens, and lands the grass in the empty moat. The picture of the Amitabha, torn in places, shines golde the last light from the darkening sky. The face of the Amitabha looks sad as it gazes at the upper side of the w

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: On top of the steep stone wall, Tsurumaru is at a loss. The evening glow is now in its final stages. The last lig of day will soon fade, and darkness will reign over the realm. Against the background of the last glow of evening, the s figure of Tsurumaru is standing alone on the lofty stone in the remains of the castle. Wretchedness!
